answers.answer: Gestational diabetes is a common cause of polyhydramnios but not the only cause. It can also occur for no reason, And if not severe, can also resolve on its own. Don't fret. I had SEVERE polyhydramnios with my first, without indication of diabetes and she was PERFECT!!! If diabetes is your cause, it is an adjustment but perfectly manageable.

Thanks for the reassurance. Things that I breezed through the first and second times seem to be causing lots of anxiety this time! Although I didn't have this problem in either previous pregnancy. I will know more today when I get the results of the initial glucose test and hopefully after the scan on wednesday 5th Jan may have a bit more reassurance. Thanks again.

question: Hi all, I'm 33 weeks pregnant with my third baby and am 38 years old. I had a check up with the midwife today and it seems there is an excess of amniotic fluid around baby. They did a glucose test as it can be a sign of gestational diabetes apparently. I won't get the results for another two days. I feel huge and am now quite worried! Has anyone else been through this? It may turn out to be nothing serious but of course I looked it up on the internet and could mean a number of quite serious complications.
title: Excess Fluid Around Baby
